Blog.post: Procrastinating ... someday a poem will be here again.

Temptation's Fiery Flames leap and dance licking at my feet it's laughter whipping fiery illusions within my darkened soul. It's crackling whispers... sway with me feel my heat, my desire within your veins let me be the temptation the demise of your purity inhale the plume of smoke riddled with my sin. Fire seduces my very core flames dance within my eyes with a scream of sated sin my soul, my being falls into temptation's fiery feeding my darkened ashes up into the night sky. © Mary Torres

Greater Things In my eyes I see the clarity of dreams so many refuse to see. I believe within my heart the possibilities of happiness whispered quietly to me. For you I feel within my being can be anything that you choose to be. In you there is a flame that will burn eternal on any road your heart seeks. For I know the pounding need of wanting something more and you are meant for the reality of greater things. © Mary Torres

Stranded High Stranded high above my own illusions I glance downward towards reality and I conclude that life is better lived with a little silver smoke a glass filled with spirits some good deeds many wicked thoughts books to sharpen the mind hand gestures to keep you fit a mattress to catch you poems to get you laid roses to get you love and lot's of money to keep you stranded high away from your illusions and life's realities. © Mary Torres I wish I did half these things... alright, I do some but not all :-)

Morning Breath I lay quietly, reflective on the crisp white sheets strewn carelessly on my bed it is early morning as the sun tries to make it's way through my curtained window I am happy, peaceful gently I pull my pillow to me closing my eyes imagining the scent and warmth of his body upon mine I take breathe, contentedly feeling my heart beat listening with a smile at words fluttering on the wind whispering into my being I rise, thoughtful disheveled in my joy sunlight bathes my skin as I open my curtained window to find him on the breeze I inhale deeply taking love into my soul. © Mary Torres

Voices It's like smelling rain weeks before a drop comes on a hot summer's day. I hear the song floating on the wind singing in my mind telling me to get ready. I feel it's cool caress on my skin, a soft breathe of invisible presence as though I'm walking amidst discarded belongings of people long past. It speaks to me with a knowing of no words with shadowed pictures of what is to come that I don't quite understand until it gets here. Intuition greets me in my sleep in every waking hour pounding at me to decipher... to listen to know what's coming. Again and again it slips through me my mind grasping to understand fate has spoken that change once again stands begging to be heard on this road of humanity and of my life. © Mary Torres

Unspoken Desires Seemingly sweet without sin on my mind I bed you take you without a soul to know I smile innocently no one to see behind my eyes I make you scream please you taste you so quiet I am it seems respectable I pretend to be without shame or sin desire racks my brain as I ravage you do things till you moan my name I am sweet innocent guilty of secret pleasures fantasies hear me, feel me yes, I am the pure that sighs the sweetness of your love whisper to me invade my mind with unspoken desires. © Mary Torres I like this one too much to leave it out :-)

My Soul My soul trembles laughing... crying within this body of mine it dies... it lives spinning on every dime it screams... and yes, it moans with every stroke of love it's wild... sinful beautiful in heaven's eyes it's high... it's low smokes the fumes of life it's gentle... kind listens to every sigh it aches... dreams blue seas my soul trembles living... loving within this body of mine. © Mary Torres

Toast of Tears This glass that I hold within my hands is filled with the blood of my tears. I have bled slowly the first drop blind of those that would follow. The sanctity of my soul trickles with every lie a crimson trail trampled by those that feed upon my heart. I raise my glass filled with the essence of my being. A toast for all those who have picked the flowers failing to leave a seed. Today we drink from this glass within my hands the last of my tears. For tomorrow my tear stained glass shall be filled with the blood of the souls that bled me. Raise the glass and drink today for vengeance is mine. © Mary Torres

Fair Heart Oh, fair heart... that beats a red sun in pure blue of skies hear this daydreamers plea scratching at her canvas with ink crackled dry. The moon has failed to rise! Drought has taken visions parching this poets soul of humble meaningless verse. Whom do I beg to delight? A scrap of pity is all I ask to cure a desolate barren prairie void of beautiful flowers and vines. Give me but a morsel... feed this canvas of mine. Oh, fair heart... hear me now! © Mary Torres

The Sign Says Closed My heart has lost it's whisper I sent it to my love with a message of eternity but the sign said closed when it reached the door... if by fate you come across it please send it home where the door to my heart is always open. © Mary Torres

First Love The years speak vividly in this one quiet moment from a distance of time and many miles your smile, your eyes take me back with a sigh I remember our laughs songs you would serenade the first kiss you sent to me on the wind of your palm youthful was our love exchanged was our hearts with just a gaze fate was understood I see you now in this photograph a boy now a grown man with a child of your own my heart swells once again with love and happiness knowing that my first love found his place in life and light in his purpose. © Mary Torres

Happy New Year! And so again it falls upon us promises made with purpose goals of pure zest days of a year made in reflection while a glittering ball rises to say hello to all that is new some will cry others will laugh many will celebrate with love and all will look back to what was while with deep bated breathe hope for the best in this new year and so it falls upon us again another chance of years past to fulfill fancy forgotten resolutions promises made with purpose and goals of pure zest in the end the glittering ball will rise once more in celebration and I for one along with others will say thank you for my life for my freedom for doing the best I could do and for the people like myself who never quite finish those promises yet stand with hopeful open hearts and those that actually do I say to you live with knowledge and faith live with compassion and kindness live with strength and courage live with purpose and love and have a Happy New Year! © Mary Torres

Garden Behind The Wall Framed by sturdy walls once more the door closes flowers will still smile with vibrant colors sunlight will still glisten on early morning dew and the birds will still sing joyously in their trees dreams will also still exist when the moon dances amongst the glittering stars all this beauty and love shall endure behind walls that frame my closing door and someday when kindness rather than impudence seeks entrance to the garden behind the closed door it will be then the walls will crumble and the key lost to a forever open door. © Mary Torres

Silent Calling It takes but a whisper a thought a calling from some wondrous invisible place I cannot see or touch to feel you wanting me loving me feeling for me breathing with me. In the darkness I feel the heavy ache of your desire pressing against my soul cradling me making love to me on a bed where I lay alone. Soft spoken silent are your words that echo reverberate within my being without sound sigh that I hear you distant in your miles as you lay unseen next to me. © Mary Torres

Fumes Inhale deeply, fill your insides with the fumes of life. Ride the wave that takes you up and down, all around. Stagger, straddle the line to the nearest hotel. Smile to passersby who know your just a little high. Smell it, taste it let it roll off your tongue. Oh sweetness, almighty go ahead take another hit. Feel rippling desire smoldering in its acidic fire. Make love, spread your seed save just a little for me. Roll it, smoke it show them how it's done. Intoxicate your soul feed your passion under the sun. Fear has no place in this high kiss inhibitions goodbye. Inhale deeply, fill your insides with the fumes of life. © Mary Torres

Golden Road Life is tangible dreams the energy the sun has risen and rested to the calling of the road inside of me it was there all this time, it was there this pull where the birds fly for warmth it was always there the pieces that floated the strings detached the feeling that it was right in front of me I touched and rode it so many times this road tried to speak bare it's words the answers it glows golden now I've found where I am to be life is energy dreams are tangible the sun exhales it's light and I read the poetry engraved upon my destined road. © Mary Torres
Will You Love Me Anyway? The passion of my words is all I have to give... all I have in my pockets is yesterdays lint. © Mary Torres

The Heavens Speak The heavens speak on this clear ebony night to those who choose ponder. Shooting stars give signs to lover's and gambler's of life showing roads of love and fate. The moon in full luminous mystery plays puppetry on the minds coercing the hidden eccentricities of the most sane into laughter. The ebony of night itself where karma ceases to exist seems as though a being greater than any sits silently hidden watching life endure in it's microscopic existence. This heavenly night so beautiful simplified to the human mind with wishing stars and lucky charms reminds those who ponder upon the vast endless universe that we are but newborn infants to the worlds and possibilities beyond our sight and touch. © Mary Torres

My Poet You are my beauty the love of my heart a sigh of wonder my souls completion You are the color that paints my canvas words that dream my imagination to fly You are the whisper that comes of my pen melodies of stories to live and awaken You are the light in the valley of mist life that grows from seed to tree You are my love heartbeat of my prose verse to my thoughts you are my poet. © Mary Torres 01/2003

The Poet I see love in the valley of mist A radiant light glows in all that is true Amidst the flowers that grow of serene colour The poet sits upon a fallen tree Head bowed down he lives within his thoughts A world spins of fantastic dreams Sweet melodies echo birds scatter in flight Pen held tightly words come to life A canvas of white sits upon his lap An explosion of colour in one small black line Word after word a story is born Upon the last drop of ink he finishes in time The poet stands upon his fallen tree Softly and quietly recites his words Never a dream from which to awaken Folds his book tucks away his pen For all that is imagined in the valley of mist For only the poet brings it to life. © Mary Torres 02/2000

Free To Be I am a helium balloon the string attached to my toe is my lifeline... it fits nicely around his finger in a cute tight little bow he is my weight... together we are grounded and joyously high. © Mary Torres

Burning Freedom Burning freedom cries a river flooding my very soul sun induced hallucinations drag me down never ending roads. Tattooed dreams line the insides of my skin painting pictures of places never been. Primitive callings scream from this darkened solitude wild that I am chaotic nature understood. High is my mind inhaling the fumes of life take me as I am or say your good bye. Burning freedom the essence of my soul cries a river on which my life flows. © Mary Torres

The Bones Brittle and dry artifacts of yesterday that is all left to pick at imagination and memories will be misconstrued when those who find them buried try to reconstruct lies from truth for it is easier to create and embrace a facade of beautiful false love than to rattle around in the bones of a heart buried in love's cemetery. © Mary Torres

Unrelinquished Love Sometimes I wonder what would be at this very moment if I had just loved you they way I should have loved you all those years ago if I had just allowed myself to fall into your arms and dive into the warm loving gaze you so readily shined upon me if I sang with you when you sang to me where would we be what would this moment be living of only love had been free perhaps it is this the unrelinquished love that makes me wonder if we were ever really meant to be. © Mary Torres

Golden Road Life is tangible dreams the energy the sun has risen and rested to the calling of the road inside of me it was there all this time, it was there this pull where the birds fly for warmth it was always there the pieces that floated the strings detached the feeling that it was right in front of me I touched and rode it so many times this road tried to speak bare it's words the answers it glows golden now I've found where I am to be life is energy dreams are tangible the sun exhales it's light and I read the poetry engraved upon my destined road. © Mary Torres

Sway If I could touch you across these miles send my love dancing across all space and time I would sway gently into your soul meld my heart to your dreams lift you to heaven as your heart your love sways dancing within me. © Mary Torres
Waters The words trickle slowly into rivers flowing release escaping the oceans lapping the sands within my being. © Mary Torres

Fleck Of Dust I am but a fleck of dust floating on the wind looking for my niche a place just for me but right when I think I've found where I should be with a swift breathe the wind blows me once again. © Mary Torres

Delightful Addiction Oh the sin I become languishing every moment yearning without moral becoming intoxicated with every turn I relish in the lies the glory and failures chills run down my spine in the splendor of their love addictive in sensual fervor they rile me to no end oh the mystery deceit and tribulations and yes, I even laugh wickedly and bashfully secretly I inhale their scent I become jealous enlightened and powerful knowledgeable my weakness screams in the strength they bring me oh but I am human and my mind heart soul rise to greater plains in this delightful addiction stone me frown upon me accept me in dramatic flair for I am who I am to my ink stained core from cover to page to word yes, I am shameless proud to be a book lover. © Mary Torres
When I Fell In Love With You My heart knew the first time I saw you for it lit up shining brightly and pounded my feet into the earth it whispered to my eyes catch me I've found love. © Mary Torres

This Crooked Road This crooked road that I was born cracked nor wise disguised and forlorn I cry here giving earth my tears sit under the barren branches of sorrow tree mountains vast distant as my years counting dreams I have screamed mercilessly frantically to the heavens for peace for sleep for anything my voice echoes landing alone unheard grasping at my feet this soul housed within my flesh lingers starved lost bumping into my heart on dark lonely nights I gaze tired defeated disillusioned my faith laughs for believing this crooked road will someday lead me home. © Mary Torres

Road To San Francisco I sat on the bridge contemplating mourning no death my glass house trembling with me as tears stained my perfectly ironed crisp facade I sat in between yesterday and the unknown of tomorrow losing nothing leaving everything I sat high above untouchable kin with the sky calm among sand colored hills on the road to San Francisco. © Mary Torres

Lead Me Away Lead me away far from what I know find me the place where kindness caresses my skin and the sun embraces my being with truth lead me away far from these walls find me the place where beauty reigns natural within and my heart beats in completion lead me away far from this sorrow find me the place where freedom gives wings to my soul and the only love is love pure in itself lead me away. © Mary Torres

Fade Not Away Fade not away from me for my light is spent Hide not in the shadows for my eyes no longer seek Awaken to beautiful sounds for my voice lingers no more Smile at joyous freedom for what was becomes boxed Find the heart that becomes you for mine did not measure Fade not away from me for my light is spent of thee. © Mary Torres

Almighty Love You give me words that transcend the barriers of my own flesh words of forebode of light and heaven of death, of life these words I dwell that breathe their existence to me manifest within my soul create in me a light to my darkness these words that haunt spiral into my being primitive as I in bare naked truth with words you give me a gift to live under the moon and sun to speak, to be to exist as one between heaven and hell with words I am free to live my heart you are the Almighty Love that created me. © Mary Torres

The Diarist If you only knew the smile you bring me the rise in my heart when I see when I read your words your feelings your experiences if you only knew how much you mean to me how much you have touched my heart with the depth and passion of your life if you only knew how special you really are to a stranger so very far away who takes joy reading your words each and every day if you only knew. © Mary Torres

Thread Of Love (written for my nephew) For all of life I shall carry you my heart will carve your name upon my soul And for every star in heaven's ebony night a wish I make for you If ever in this life you need a place to be the road home will guide you to me Young heart through old the thread of love will always be the light for you little boy who gave love to life. © Mary Torres

Heaven's Door For a brief moment time stood still no sounds no movements all that was beat softly quietly in my chest I felt my heart and it was filled with love so many faces so much sorrow the goodbyes heavy I wondered if my soul could hold the memories or would they fade with my light I stood there too early for my time face to face with mortality with my goodness and my sins waiting to know if He was ready for me for a brief moment I discovered life it's meaning as I stood not ready at Heaven's door. © Mary Torres

A Heart's Letter I strolled the fine lines the delicate curves rode on every sudden flair my heart pounded as fingertips caressed the smooth plain of this antiquated art. With every step he lifted my heart into his beautiful world I sighed with love he captured me. Slower I strode not wanting to finish the ink glinted new under the sunlight the words poetic classic in it's courting. I inhaled deeply this old era once lost as I held his love letter deep and near my heart. © Mary Torres

No Need To Say Goodbye Each day I came here searching for a sign some word or breathe of your existence. I searched for you... But time kicked my ass as silence and words that I cherished became painted graffiti upon our friendship. © Mary Torres

In Your Eyes All I saw was truth then your back it's silence spoke 'I don't care' executing me with blunt force but your eyes before you turned your deep warm eyes betrayed you when they locked into mine my every move I saw your heart sad in them wanting to love but turning instead. © Mary Torres

The Lonely Storm It settled upon me crawling slowly grasping in the dark It found my heart then exhaled sorrow on my soul I held the tears heaving their weight against thoughts biting at my facade Wave after wave came crashing as loneliness stormed my tranquil being. © Mary Torres

Mi Corazon (My Heart) You stood on the corner strong beautiful life tattooed on and in you. I knew right then that you were the one. Your eyes brown knowing oldies in your weary heart. I exploded with memories yet to be already made. I knew right then that you were my love mi corazon. © Mary Torres

Outlaw Rose Between the cracks the saw dust and tears a seed fell by chance lodging itself stubbornly into my broken heart. It bloomed of course against my wishes it's red delicate beauty forcing sun to cast light on desolate surroundings. I tried to name it put a face on it's petals but it refused to answer turning in defiance to all suggestions spoken. Love began to grow for this outlaw of a rose it's home began to heal saw dust found the wind cracks mended wisely tears flowed for happiness. After many days I longed for the name of this grand beauty planted within my heart so I asked quietly 'how much more time?' With that the little outlaw lifted it's petals high extending love to my eyes I realized just then this blessed rose was Time. © Mary Torres
